final_output:
Final Assessment:
High‑grade ovarian clear cell carcinoma, platinum‑resistant, with progressive hepatic and presacral/sacral/iliac bone metastases and severe anemia; main uncertainties are performance status, anemia etiology, and trial options.

Core Treatment Strategy:
- Immediately investigate and correct anemia (iron/B12/folate, hemolysis, transfusion as needed) before further systemic therapy [@20230103|5600862 | LAB].  
- Document ECOG status, pain (including bone/neurologic), and prior toxicity to define feasible non‑platinum relapse‑therapy intensity [@guideline:esmo_cpg_epithelialovarian_2023__v00000000 | Page 10].  
- Plan non‑platinum systemic relapse therapy for platinum‑resistant clear cell disease once optimized; parallelly screen for eligible phase Ib/II trials [@OH2203828 | Genomics][@pubmed | 30109783][@trial | 350].  
- Use 2022‑12‑29 CT/MR as staging baseline; repeat CT/MR if clinical status changes, reserving PET‑CT only if results would alter systemic or palliative local strategies [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT][@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].  

Change Triggers:
- If anemia persists or worsens despite work‑up/treatment, delay or de‑escalate systemic therapy intensity and prioritize supportive measures.  
- If new focal bone/neurologic symptoms or rapid marker rise occur, obtain urgent targeted imaging and consider palliative radiotherapy or adjusted systemic approach.

initial_ops.chair:
- Platinum‑resistant metastatic clear cell ovarian carcinoma with rapid progression in liver, presacral/sacral and bone; systemic non‑platinum regimen indicated [@guideline:esmo_cpg_epithelialovarian_2023__v00000000 | Page 10].  

- Baseline anemia (Hgb 74 g/L) requires correction and transfusion/iron assessment before starting further systemic therapy [@20230103|5600862 | LAB].  

- Before firm plan: document ECOG status, pain/skeletal symptoms, prior toxicities, and confirm current MRI/CT images and full NGS interpretation details [@OH2203828 | Genomics].
initial_ops.oncologist:
- Platinum-resistant recurrent clear cell ovarian carcinoma with rising CA125/CA19-9 and new liver/bone metastases; systemic relapse-therapy category indicated. [@20221229|9703212 | LAB] [@guideline:esmo_cpg_epithelialovarian_2023__v00000000 | Page 10]  

- Significant anemia (Hgb 74 g/L) may limit intensity of cytotoxic systemic therapy; requires optimization/transfusion before full-dose treatment. [@20230103|5600862 | LAB]  

- Organ function (renal/hepatic) appears acceptable for most systemic options; confirm current performance status and recent cross-sectional imaging details for planning. [@20221229|8300002 | LAB]
initial_ops.radiologist:
- Progressive presacral pelvic mass with sacral and right iliac bone involvement; multiple stable pelvic mesenteric/peritoneal nodules suspicious for metastases [@2022-10-24|MR | MR] [@2022-12-29|MR | MR].  

- Liver: multiple metastatic nodules increasing in number and size; spleen with patchy low‑density area possibly infarct, needs clinical correlation [@2022-12-29|CT | CT].  

- Cross‑sectional CT/MRI adequately demonstrate advanced, recurrent disease distribution for MDT treatment planning [@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].
initial_ops.pathologist:
- Morphology and IHC strongly support recurrent ovarian clear cell carcinoma involving rectosigmoid, retroperitoneum, and vagina, high‑grade. [@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 6]

- MMR proteins intact; no evidence of MMR deficiency/MSI‑H on IHC. [@2022-03-28 | LAB]

- Comprehensive NGS: germline ATM p.Y316C; BRCA1/2 and HRD negative; no other pathogenic HRR variants detected. [@OH2203828 | Genomics]
initial_ops.nuclear:
- Known pelvic presacral mass with sacral and right iliac bone involvement; PET could better define osseous/metastatic extent and activity [@2022-12-29|MR | MR].

- Progressive multifocal hepatic metastases on CT; PET would refine whole‑body metastatic burden and extrahepatic disease mapping [@2022-12-29|CT | CT].

- For advanced/recurrent ovarian carcinoma, PET‑CT is an acceptable staging option complementing MRI/CT for planning [@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].

merged_summary:
Key Knowledge:
- Platinum‑resistant recurrent high‑grade clear cell ovarian carcinoma with rapid systemic progression (liver, presacral/sacral, pelvic bone, peritoneal nodules).
- Rising CA125/CA19‑9 consistent with radiologic progression.
- Significant anemia (Hgb 74 g/L) requiring correction; renal/hepatic function acceptable for systemic therapy once optimized.
- Histology/IHC confirm pure high‑grade ovarian clear cell carcinoma; MMR proficient (MLH1/MSH2/MSH6/PMS2 retained), ER/PR focally expressed; BRCA1/2 and HRD negative; germline ATM p.Y316C variant noted.
- Current staging is based on 2022‑12‑29 CT/MR showing progressive liver and presacral/sacral disease; PET‑CT not yet performed and considered only if management‑altering.

Controversies:
- Optimal non‑platinum relapse regimen and intensity for platinum‑resistant clear cell histology in the setting of severe baseline anemia.
- Threshold for ordering PET‑CT versus repeating CT/MR alone, and whether PET findings would realistically change systemic versus palliative local strategies.
- Clinical actionability and trial relevance of the germline ATM variant in this patient’s context.

Missing Info:
- ECOG performance status and detailed symptom burden (pain, skeletal, neurologic, functional impact).
- Full prior treatment toxicity history and current medications.
- Confirmation that no post‑2022‑12‑29 CT/MRI exists; need for updated cross‑sectional imaging if disease status is uncertain.
- Integrated NGS/molecular addendum summarizing HRD‑negative, BRCA‑wild‑type status and detailed classification/implications of ATM p.Y316C.
- Current anemia work‑up (iron/B12/folate, hemolysis markers) and transfusion/iron replacement history.

Working Plan:
- Correct severe anemia and complete anemia work‑up; then reassess suitability for full‑dose non‑platinum systemic therapy.
- Document ECOG, symptom burden (including bone/neurologic symptoms), and prior toxicities to individualize relapse systemic regimen and supportive care.
- Confirm absence of more recent imaging; update staging with new CT/MR if prior (2022‑12‑29) set is outdated or discordant with current symptoms.
- Consider FDG PET‑CT only if additional disease mapping would change systemic regimen choice, clinical trial eligibility, or local palliative interventions (e.g., radiotherapy targeting).
- Finalize pathology/molecular documentation: issue addendum confirming pure clear cell histology, MMR proficiency, ER/PR status, and integrated summary of HRD‑negative, BRCA‑wild‑type, and ATM variant, to support systemic and trial planning.

Round 1.chair:
- Correct severe anemia and clarify ECOG, symptom burden, prior toxicities before initiating any non‑platinum systemic therapy [@20230103|5600862 | LAB].  

- Proceed with non‑platinum systemic regimen suitable for platinum‑resistant clear cell disease once optimized, considering trial options and ATM‑related eligibility [@OH2203828 | Genomics][@pubmed | 30109783].  

- Update staging with latest CT/MRI; add PET‑CT only if results would change systemic versus palliative local strategy [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT][@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].
Round 1.oncologist:
- Correct anemia and document ECOG, symptom burden, and prior toxicities before initiating individualized non‑platinum relapse systemic therapy. [@20230103|5600862 | LAB] [@guideline:esmo_cpg_epithelialovarian_2023__v00000000 | Page 10]  

- Proceed with systemic relapse‑therapy planning assuming clear cell histology, MMR proficiency, BRCA/HRD negativity, and germline ATM variant per NGS. [@OH2203828 | Genomics] [@pubmed | 30109783]  

- Confirm no post‑2022‑12‑29 CT/MRI; order PET‑CT only if results would modify systemic choice or local palliative interventions. [@2022-12-29|MR | MR] [@2022-12-29|CT | CT]
Round 1.radiologist:
- No cross‑sectional imaging is available after 2022‑12‑29; current staging relies on that CT/MR set [@2022-12-29|MR | MR] [@2022-12-29|CT | CT].  

- Before PET‑CT, clarify whether updated CT/MR is planned; PET should be reserved for scenarios where it may alter management [@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].  

- Document any new focal bone or neurologic symptoms to prioritize targeted imaging (e.g., spine/pelvis MRI) if clinically indicated [@2022-12-29|MR | MR].
Round 1.pathologist:
- Confirm final histology as pure high‑grade ovarian clear cell carcinoma; no morphologic evidence of mixed or alternative histotype. [@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 6]

- Clearly state MMR proficiency (MLH1/MSH2/MSH6/PMS2 retained) and ER/PR focal expression in the pathology addendum. [@2022-03-28 | LAB]

- Request integrated molecular addendum summarizing HRD‑negative, BRCA‑wild‑type status and detailing germline ATM p.Y316C classification/implications. [@OH2203828 | Genomics]
Round 1.nuclear:
- No PET-CT yet; recommend whole‑body FDG PET-CT only if updated mapping would alter local palliation or systemic strategy [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT][@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].

- Current staging rests on 2022-12-29 CT/MR showing progressive liver and presacral/sacral disease; repeat cross‑sectional imaging before PET if outdated [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT].

- When performed, PET interpretation should focus on defining true osseous and extrahepatic metastatic burden beyond MRI/CT, to refine radiotherapy targeting [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT].

chair.oncologist: Before finalizing a non‑platinum regimen, we must correct severe anemia and document ECOG and prior toxicities; otherwise regimen intensity decisions risk excess toxicity [@20230103|5600862 | LAB].
chair.radiologist: Please confirm whether any CT/MRI after 2022‑12‑29/30 exist and, if not, whether PET‑CT would realistically change local vs systemic planning [@2022-12-29|MR] [@2022-12-29|CT].
chair.pathologist: Kindly clarify in the report whether any features suggest alternative histotype or mixed tumor, as this could alter systemic strategy [@2022-03-28 | CT].
chair.nuclear: Given already clear hepatic and bone metastases on CT/MRI, please advise if PET‑CT would add actionable information beyond current staging [@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].

oncologist.chair: Before committing to a specific non‑platinum systemic strategy, I need ECOG status, detailed symptom burden, and prior toxicity profile to judge tolerability and dose intensity; anemia work‑up and transfusion plan should be clarified urgently to avoid under‑ or overdosing cytotoxic therapy in the context of Hgb 74 g/L. [@20230103|5600862 | LAB]

radiologist.chair: Imaging facts in the MDT summary (widespread hepatic and pelvic osseous disease) match only the 2022-12-29 CT/MR; please confirm there is no more recent CT/MRI, otherwise updated scans are needed to guide current decisions [@2022-12-29|MR | MR] [@2022-12-29|CT | CT].

pathologist.oncologist: From pathology side, key missing item is a detailed NGS interpretive report classifying the germline ATM p.Y316C variant (pathogenic vs VUS) and commenting on trial eligibility. [@OH2203828 | Genomics]

nuclear.radiologist: From nuclear perspective, no actual PET report is available; if PET-CT is intended to guide further local measures, please confirm whether any PET has been performed after 2022-12-29 cross-sectional imaging or explicitly schedule one, as current staging relies solely on MRI/CT [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT].

Working Plan:
- Correct severe anemia and complete anemia work‑up; then reassess suitability for full‑dose non‑platinum systemic therapy.
- Document ECOG, symptom burden (including bone/neurologic symptoms), and prior toxicities to individualize relapse systemic regimen and supportive care.

chair.assistant_reply:
Final Assessment:
High‑grade ovarian clear cell carcinoma, platinum‑resistant, with progressive hepatic and presacral/sacral/iliac bone metastases and severe anemia; main uncertainties are performance status, anemia etiology, and trial options.

Core Treatment Strategy:
- Immediately investigate and correct anemia (iron/B12/folate, hemolysis, transfusion as needed) before further systemic therapy [@20230103|5600862 | LAB].  
- Document ECOG status, pain (including bone/neurologic), and prior toxicity to define feasible non‑platinum relapse‑therapy intensity [@guideline:esmo_cpg_epithelialovarian_2023__v00000000 | Page 10].  
- Plan non‑platinum systemic relapse therapy for platinum‑resistant clear cell disease once optimized; parallelly screen for eligible phase Ib/II trials [@OH2203828 | Genomics][@pubmed | 30109783][@trial | 350].  
- Use 2022‑12‑29 CT/MR as staging baseline; repeat CT/MR if clinical status changes, reserving PET‑CT only if results would alter systemic or palliative local strategies [@2022-12-29|MR | MR][@2022-12-29|CT | CT][@guideline:esgo_esmo_esp_consensus_ovariancancer_2024__v00000000 | Page 8].  

Change Triggers:
- If anemia persists or worsens despite work‑up/treatment, delay or de‑escalate systemic therapy intensity and prioritize supportive measures.  
- If new focal bone/neurologic symptoms or rapid marker rise occur, obtain urgent targeted imaging and consider palliative radiotherapy or adjusted systemic approach.

[MDT_GLOBAL_KNOWLEDGE]
Key Knowledge:
- Platinum‑resistant recurrent high‑grade clear cell ovarian carcinoma with rapid systemic progression (liver, presacral/sacral, pelvic bone, peritoneal nodules).
- Rising tumor markers (CA125/CA19‑9) consistent with radiologic progression.
- Significant anemia (Hgb 74 g/L) requiring correction; renal/hepatic function otherwise acceptable for systemic therapy.
- Histology/IHC confirm clear cell carcinoma; MMR proficient (no MSI‑H), BRCA1/2 and HRD negative; germline ATM variant of note without clear targetable HRR implication.
- Current CT/MRI show extensive hepatic and pelvic osseous disease; PET‑CT could further refine whole‑body metastatic burden.

Controversies:
- Optimal choice and intensity of non‑platinum systemic regimen in the context of severe anemia and clear cell histology.
- Added value and timing of PET‑CT given already advanced disease documented on CT/MRI.
- Relevance and actionability of germline ATM variant in this clinical context.

Missing Info:
- ECOG performance status and detailed symptom burden (pain, skeletal symptoms, functional impact).
- Full toxicity history from prior therapies and current medications.
- Most recent cross‑sectional imaging dates and formal reports; any interval changes since last CT/MRI.
- Detailed NGS interpretive report regarding ATM variant classification and potential clinical trial options.
- Current anemia work‑up (iron studies, B12/folate, hemolysis markers) and transfusion history.

Working Plan:
- Optimize anemia before further systemic therapy (transfusion +/- iron/other as indicated) and reassess fitness for treatment.
- Document ECOG status, pain/skeletal symptoms, and prior treatment toxicities to guide regimen selection.
- Confirm and review latest CT/MRI; consider PET‑CT for full metastatic mapping if results would alter systemic or palliative local approaches.
- Discuss non‑platinum systemic options appropriate for platinum‑resistant clear cell histology, tailored to organ function and performance status.
- Review full NGS report including ATM variant in molecular tumor board context for potential trial eligibility or targeted strategies.

Key Knowledge:
- Platinum‑resistant recurrent high‑grade clear cell ovarian carcinoma with rapid systemic progression (liver, presacral/sacral, pelvic bone, peritoneal nodules).
- Rising tumor markers (CA125/CA19‑9) consistent with radiologic progression.
- Significant anemia (Hgb 74 g/L) requiring correction; renal/hepatic function otherwise acceptable for systemic therapy.
- Histology/IHC confirm clear cell carcinoma; MMR proficient (no MSI‑H), BRCA1/2 and HRD negative; germline ATM variant of note without clear targetable HRR implication.
- Current CT/MRI show extensive hepatic and pelvic osseous disease; PET‑CT could further refine whole‑body metastatic burden.

Controversies:
- Optimal choice and intensity of non‑platinum systemic regimen in the context of severe anemia and clear cell histology.
- Added value and timing of PET‑CT given already advanced disease documented on CT/MRI.
- Relevance and actionability of germline ATM variant in this clinical context.

Missing Info:
- ECOG performance status and detailed symptom burden (pain, skeletal symptoms, functional impact).
- Full toxicity history from prior therapies and current medications.
- Most recent cross‑sectional imaging dates and formal reports; any interval changes since last CT/MRI.
- Detailed NGS interpretive report regarding ATM variant classification and potential clinical trial options.
- Current anemia work‑up (iron studies, B12/folate, hemolysis markers) and transfusion history.

Working Plan:
- Optimize anemia before further systemic therapy (transfusion +/- iron/other as indicated) and reassess fitness for treatment.
- Document ECOG status, pain/skeletal symptoms, and prior treatment toxicities to guide regimen selection.
- Confirm and review latest CT/MRI; consider PET‑CT for full metastatic mapping if results would alter systemic or palliative local approaches.
- Discuss non‑platinum systemic options appropriate for platinum‑resistant clear cell histology, tailored to organ function and performance status.
- Review full NGS report including ATM variant in molecular tumor board context for potential trial eligibility or targeted strategies.

assistant.assistant_reply:
Key Knowledge:
- Platinum‑resistant recurrent high‑grade clear cell ovarian carcinoma with rapid systemic progression (liver, presacral/sacral, pelvic bone, peritoneal nodules).
- Rising CA125/CA19‑9 consistent with radiologic progression.
- Significant anemia (Hgb 74 g/L) requiring correction; renal/hepatic function acceptable for systemic therapy once optimized.
- Histology/IHC confirm pure high‑grade ovarian clear cell carcinoma; MMR proficient (MLH1/MSH2/MSH6/PMS2 retained), ER/PR focally expressed; BRCA1/2 and HRD negative; germline ATM p.Y316C variant noted.
- Current staging is based on 2022‑12‑29 CT/MR showing progressive liver and presacral/sacral disease; PET‑CT not yet performed and considered only if management‑altering.

Controversies:
- Optimal non‑platinum relapse regimen and intensity for platinum‑resistant clear cell histology in the setting of severe baseline anemia.
- Threshold for ordering PET‑CT versus repeating CT/MR alone, and whether PET findings would realistically change systemic versus palliative local strategies.
- Clinical actionability and trial relevance of the germline ATM variant in this patient’s context.

Missing Info:
- ECOG performance status and detailed symptom burden (pain, skeletal, neurologic, functional impact).
- Full prior treatment toxicity history and current medications.
- Confirmation that no post‑2022‑12‑29 CT/MRI exists; need for updated cross‑sectional imaging if disease status is uncertain.
- Integrated NGS/molecular addendum summarizing HRD‑negative, BRCA‑wild‑type status and detailed classification/implications of ATM p.Y316C.
- Current anemia work‑up (iron/B12/folate, hemolysis markers) and transfusion/iron replacement history.

Working Plan:
- Correct severe anemia and complete anemia work‑up; then reassess suitability for full‑dose non‑platinum systemic therapy.
- Document ECOG, symptom burden (including bone/neurologic symptoms), and prior toxicities to individualize relapse systemic regimen and supportive care.
- Confirm absence of more recent imaging; update staging with new CT/MR if prior (2022‑12‑29) set is outdated or discordant with current symptoms.
- Consider FDG PET‑CT only if additional disease mapping would change systemic regimen choice, clinical trial eligibility, or local palliative interventions (e.g., radiotherapy targeting).
- Finalize pathology/molecular documentation: issue addendum confirming pure clear cell histology, MMR proficiency, ER/PR status, and integrated summary of HRD‑negative, BRCA‑wild‑type, and ATM variant, to support systemic and trial planning.
